result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen Marie Michalovitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

miscConds.notes: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Same conditions for both counts.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karen Marie Michalovitz

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by defendant

10:12 AM Defendant Karen Marie Michalovitz in court.  Attorney Jonathan Ross in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ross stated the defendant appeared for the pretrial and wanted to proceed prose. Court questioned the defendant, she would like to accept the offer. Case will be recalled. 10:15/10:56 Appearances the same. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the waiver of attorney form with the defendant, accepted her waiver. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2 & 3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Counts 1 & 4 dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 24 months for each count. Conditions of probation include: Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Costs on count 2 of $443.00 and count 3 $243.00. 5 days credit. 11:13 AM
Standard felony conditions, Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia.

1:52 PM Defendant Karen Marie Michalovitz appeared by video.  Attorney Gibson D Hatch appeared by video for Karen Marie Michalovitz.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waived reading of complaint. Advisement of rights. Bond recommendations. Court set $1000.00 signature bond. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. 1:56 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:50 am.
Return date scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
